## 1009. WET
### Definition
Most generic adjective describing presence of water, not merely moisture or humidity. Presence of water throughout a material, not just surface moisture. Antonym of "dry". Avoid terms specifically for change of state. Avoid intensive meanings, e.g. "soaked". Avoid terms specifically for humidity in the air. (CoBL)

### Contexts
1. This shirt is wet, take it off. 2. This stone is wet, do not sit on it. 3. A wet match will not burn, a dry one will.
